description: [at American City Business Journals] - Mitel (MITL) has agreed to divest its mobile business in a deal that puts the base of a new combined company in Dallas. Affiliates of digital communication company Xura, Inc. have agreed to purchase Mitel Mobile for $350 million in cash, a $35 million non-interest promissory note and an equity interest in the combined company’s new owner, Sierra Private Investments L.P. The new company will be based in Dallas, according to a release.
title: Mitel offloads mobile division for $385 million, creating new Dallas company
